definition: Li (c. 2000 BC), sixth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Ai 哀[Ai1]
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Identify his anti- Confucianism by analyzing Ji Kang's poems and prose.
sentences.chinese: 通過分析詩文來釐清嵇康的反儒色彩。

sentences.english: Enterprise clarifies, cuts through, and captures, the essence of the evolutionary spirit.
sentences.chinese: 進取心可以釐清一切，披荊斬棘直搗演化的精髓。

sentences.english: Insured's QC report to verify whether the product in question is defective.
sentences.chinese: 被保險人之品管報告以釐清此產品是否有瑕疵。

sentences.english: The dissertation clarifies the system ascription of the citation of administrative law.
sentences.chinese: 釐清了行政法援用的制度歸屬。

sentences.english: But in fact, the true meaning of disaster relief must be clarified.
sentences.chinese: 但事實上，救災的真義必須得到釐清。

sentences.english: I was hoping Sully would smooth it out for me.
sentences.chinese: 我希望薩利能幫我釐清這個。

sentences.english: The definition of popular literature is a primary issue in the study of popular literature.
sentences.chinese: 釐清“俗文學”的概念是俗文學研究的首要問題。

sentences.english: According to the geological section, we clarified the stratum Parasequence of Meifeng formation.
sentences.chinese: 通過剖面測制，釐清了美豐組的地層層序。

sentences.english: Paper clarified the concept of sex-based discrimination in employment.
sentences.chinese: 論文釐清了女性就業性別歧視的概念。

sentences.english: Therefore, the clarification of this theory is helpful for the comprehension of his thought of Ming-ti.
sentences.chinese: 是故，對此說之釐清，有助於對其明體思想之理解。

sentences.english: We will specify the plan next time we meet.
sentences.chinese: 我們下一次見面的時後將要釐清這計劃。

definition: the rise and fall of the terrain (idiom)/(fig.) the whole sequence of events/causes and effects
to face squarely/to meet head on/to face up to
to question closely/to investigate in detail/to examine minutely/to get to the heart of the matter
to try/to make an attempt/to think of a way (to accomplish sth)
to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
first draft/to draw up (a first version)
